page.title: 18Recollections of Holmfirth
page.content: We interviewed a lady who has lived in Holmfirth for fifty-seven years to see how things had changed."Quite a few years ago Rotcher(a road in Holmfirth) was much quieter.Men used to come around to the houses selling pots.The milk was brought around on a cart pulled by a horse too.The milk came in a big churn.You got your own jug and told the milkman how much you wanted.Rotcher is very busy now with cars taking children up to school. There were very few cars in days gone by.Since tourists have started coming to the town things have changed a great deal.Many of the shops are geared to selling things for tourists and the town has become very busy.The tourists started coming when 'Last of the Summer Wine' was filmed here."
